messages.message: I say this knowing that tables are hard AF to display responsive and tidily: The results table seems somewhat messy and has over lapping contents:
ah thanks, yeah it seems like information is spilling out of some cells into the next row

cc @Kaustubh (KD) @lydia tagging you so we have some visibility. I’m going to also carve out some time to implement this (https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/FLOW-9200) as part of the results table improvements we’ve discussed
:+1: let me create an EPD ticket to track this
does this happen when there are too many columns? or rows?
if you look at this (https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/INSIGHTS-6512) jira epic, there’s two epd tickets linked, can you also link the one you create to this?
actually @lydia I think the ticket you just created is a duplicate of https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/EPD-2444

> does this happen when there are too many columns? or rows?
this is happening for a slightly different reason, the content of the cell is too large so it’s overflowing.

hmm so I know there are many improvements we could make, but the top two I see here are:
• No value found is overlapping incorrectly with rest of the field content
• When there is a small space for displaying the table, the table headers get squished together to be unreadable - it should handle shrinking more gracefully.
Would either of those issues be covered in 2444 or 2137?

The table shrinking gracefully issue is something I'm also seeing on the component with large excel tables (which might have 30-50 cols) - not just in the results table, but also in the right side pane

can you elaborate on the table shrinking issue? i’m not sure I totally understand. I do think however that EPD-2444 (which would be implemented by this (https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/FLOW-9200)) should assist in this, since it will add virtualization in both directions of the table (currently only the rows are virtualized so if there are many columns the table becomes less performant)
I mean that the table headers here are basically unreadable, and it looks like we're just not correctly handling small widths
ah i see — yeah i’m not too sure about this one i’d have to take a closer took
I think top priority is to handle the overlapping content. Let me use the ticket I created for that and make it a bug fix
Let's sync tomorrow in our chat with KD on if there are any other table improvememnts we want to scope in to next sprint
I think these are  different as the ticket you linked @jack.robbins deals with the editor for table fields, which has a different design/component
